oracle.pg.rdbms

Class Oracle

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.rdbms.Oracle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Oracle
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class manages the RDBMS JDBC connection to an Oracle semantic store. Many convenience methods are provided to insert rows, execute SQL statements, etc.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Zhe Wu

      This constant denotes the Oracle error code for a non sharded databases

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Oracle(java.sql.Connection conn)
      Constructs a new instance based on the JDBC connection passed in.

      Constructs a new instance based on the JDBC connection passed in.
      Oracle(oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection conn, javax.sql.DataSource ds)
      Constructs a new instance based on the JDBC connection passed in.
      Oracle(oracle.jdbc.pool.OracleDataSource ods)
      Constructs a new instance based on the data source object passed in.
      Oracle(java.lang.String url, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pass)
      Constructs a new instance based on the JDBC connection and login information passed in.

        public Oracle(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Constructs a new instance based on the JDBC connection passed in.
        Parameters:
        conn - an OracleConnection object. It MUST not be null

        Constructs a new instance based on the JDBC connection passed in.
        Parameters:
        conn - an OracleConnection object. It MUST not be null

      • Oracle

        public Oracle(oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection conn,
              javax.sql.DataSource ds)
        Constructs a new instance based on the JDBC connection passed in.
        Parameters:
        conn - an OracleConnection object. It MUST not be null
        ds - a DataSource object able to get OracleConnection objects

      • Oracle

        public Oracle(oracle.jdbc.pool.OracleDataSource ods)
        Constructs a new instance based on the data source object passed in.
        Parameters:
        ods - an OracleDataSource object. It MUST not be null

      • Oracle

        public Oracle(java.lang.String url,
              java.lang.String user,
              java.lang.String pass)
        Constructs a new instance based on the JDBC connection and login information passed in.
        Parameters:
        url - JDBC URL that identifies an Oracle database
        user - username of a database schema
        pass - password to authenticate

      • cloneConnection

        public oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection cloneConnection()
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns a new instance of OracleConnection. Callers of this method are reponsible for closing the returned connection object.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • commitTransaction

        public void commitTransaction()
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Persists changes made through this Oracle connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Closes the underlying JDBC connection after a rollback. If changes need to be persisted, be sure to issue a commitTransaction() call before this method call.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String s)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the given query and returns a query result set. The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set. In case there is a SQLException caused by the query execution, then the statement will be closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        s - the SQL command
        Returns:
        The result set. The caller is responsible for closing the Statement backing the returned ResultSet.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String s,
                                       int iTimeout,
                                       int iDOP)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the given query and returns a query result set. The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set. In case there is a SQLException caused by the query execution, then the statement will be closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        s - the SQL command
        iTimeout - number of seconds the system will wait for execution to finish
        iDOP - degree of parallelism to execute the query.
        Returns:
        The result set. The caller is responsible for closing the Statement backing the returned ResultSet.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String s,
                                       int iTimeout,
                                       int iDOP,
                                       java.util.List listBindValues)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the given query and returns a query result set. The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set. In case there is a SQLException caused by the query execution, then the statement will be closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        s - the SQL command
        iTimeout - number of seconds the system will wait for execution to finish
        iDOP - degree of parallelism to execute the query.
        listBindValues - the list of binding values
        Returns:
        The result set. The caller is responsible for closing the Statement backing the returned ResultSet.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • executeQueryWithArg

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQueryWithArg(java.lang.String s,
                                              java.lang.String arg,
                                              java.lang.String arg2)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes a SQL statement and returns a result set. The statement used to run the query is not closed (and cannot be closed in this method). The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set.
        Parameters:
        s - SQL statement to be executed.
        arg - value of the first bind variable
        arg2 - value of the second bind variable
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • executeQueryWithArg

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQueryWithArg(java.lang.String s,
                                              java.lang.String arg,
                                              java.lang.String arg2,
                                              java.lang.String arg3)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes a SQL statement and returns a result set. The statement used to run the query is not closed (and cannot be closed in this method). The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set.
        Parameters:
        s - SQL statement to be executed.
        arg - value of the first bind variable
        arg2 - value of the second bind variable
        arg3 - value of the third bind variable
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

        Parameters:
        conn - Database connection
        s - SQL statement
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • getConnection

        public oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection getConnection()
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the underlying OracleConnection object upon request. A new instance of OracleConnection will be created if this method is called for the first time.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is any problem establishing a connection to the server.

        public java.lang.String getSessionID()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException

      • isOpgAPIsLoaded

        public boolean isOpgAPIsLoaded()
        Validates if the OPG APIs (catopg.sql) has been loaded into the Oracle Database
        Returns:
        TRUE if catopg.sql has been loaded into the Oracle database.

        public boolean isShardingDb()

      • setSessionQueryDOP

        public static void setSessionQueryDOP(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                      int dop)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Sets the degree of parallel query execution at the session level.
        Parameters:
        dop - degree of parallelism. The value can be zero. If the value is negative, then it is no op.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • setSessionQueryDOP

        public void setSessionQueryDOP(int dop)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Sets the degree of parallel query execution at the session level.
        Parameters:
        dop - degree of parallelism. The value can be zero. If the value is negative, then it is no op.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
